html: Tribulation prevails for Jehovah’s people as they suffer (1) desolation and ruin, and (2) famine and the sword until Jehovah reverses the circumstances of those who repent (vv 21-23). Whether meted out through the king of Assyria/Babylon or his proxies—Jehovah’s sword and wrath—the descent phase of Jehovah’s people through trials and afflictions is proportional to their ascent phase as they are reborn or re-created on higher spiritual levels. The term “twofold,” therefore, suggests that for those of Jehovah’s people who didn’t repent in time, double trouble finally brings them to such rebirth.
